creator: Juha.Laiho@iki.fi
text:
Trying to see CoyoteConnecotr settings through the admin webapp in
Tomcat 4.1.30 produces the following stack trace. It seems that the
CoyoteConnector included in 4.1.30 does not provide the getAllowTrace
function that the admin app is trying to call. The getAllowTrace
appears to be defined in the CoyoteConnector provided with Tomcat 5,
so this looks like a versioning conflict between CoyoteConnector and
admin webapp.

Trace:
2004-03-14 18:05:01 action: Error retrieving attribute allowTrace
javax.management.ReflectionException: Cannot find getter method 
getAllowTracenested exception is java.lang.NoSuchMethodException: 
org.apache.coyote.tomcat4.CoyoteConnector.getAllowTrace()
java.lang.NoSuchMethodException: 
org.apache.coyote.tomcat4.CoyoteConnector.getAllowTrace()

        at java.lang.Class.getMethod(Class.java:963)
        at org.apache.commons.modeler.BaseModelMBean.getAttribute
(BaseModelMBean.java:326)
        at mx4j.server.interceptor.InvokerMBeanServerInterceptor.getAttribute
(InvokerMBeanServerInterceptor.java:242)

(DefaultMBeanServerInterceptor.java:138)

        at mx4j.server.MBeanServerImpl.getAttribute(MBeanServerImpl.java:1237)
        at org.apache.webapp.admin.connector.EditConnectorAction.perform
(EditConnectorAction.java:224)
        at org.apache.struts.action.Action.execute(Action.java:420)
        at org.apache.struts.action.RequestProcessor.processActionPerform
(RequestProcessor.java:484)
        at org.apache.struts.action.RequestProcessor.process
(RequestProcessor.java:274)
        at org.apache.struts.action.ActionServlet.process
(ActionServlet.java:1482)
        at org.apache.struts.action.ActionServlet.doGet(ActionServlet.java:507)
        at javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet.service(HttpServlet.java:740)
        at javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet.service(HttpServlet.java:853)
        at org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationFilterChain.internalDoFilter
(ApplicationFilterChain.java:247)

t(StandardPipeline.java:641)

creator: Larry.Isaacs@sas.com
text:
I can claim credit for committing the "AllowTrace" change, not realizing that
the TOMCAT_4_1_30 tag had already been added to jakarta-tomcat-connectors.  The
Tomcat 4.1.30 binaries appear to have been built with a CoyoteConnector that
was out of sync with changes that did get included in the admin webapp.
However, it turns out the the 4.1.30-LE-jdk14 version did manager to pickup the
desired CoyoteConnector. Thus the LE-jkd14 versions don't have this problem.

If you aren't able to use the LE-jdk14 version directly, download a copy and
copy the tomcat-coyote.jar from the LE-jdk14 version to your installation's
server/lib directory.

Marking as FIXED since CVS already contains the desired code.
